atableExtra 0.1.0
  • Reference

Format summary statistics for numeric variables when using `numeric_stats`

format_statistics.numeric_stats.Rd

format_statistics.numeric_stats can use any statistic returned by `numeric_stats`.

# S3 method for numeric_stats
format_statistics(
  x,
  numstats = c(`Mean (SD)` = "{mean} ({sd})", `Min - Max` = "{q0} - {q1}", `Median
    [Quartiles]` = "{q0.5} [{q0.25}; {q0.75}]")[1],
  missingformat = c(`Valid (missing)` = "{Nvalid} ({Nmissing})"),
  ...
)

Arguments

x

`numeric_stats` object
numstats

either a number (1 to 3, referring to the defaults in the order printed) or a named character of the format shown above (i.e. 'Text to print in table' = 'variable1 to use (variable2 to use)'). Defaults to `"Mean (SD)" = "mean (sd)"`, equivilent to 1.
missingformat

either a logical or a named string defining the format
...

passed to/from other methods

Details

All numbers are formatted by the function in `atable_options("format_numbers")`. To use a different method, reassign that function.

Options `numstats` and `missingformat` use the `glue` package to create strings. Although `glue` parses the values within the braces (`` and ``), this is not permitted in this case as only strings are passed to `glue`.

Examples


require(atable)
atable_options(statistics.numeric = numeric_stats)
data(mtcars)
# atableExtra default
atable(mpg ~ am, mtcars)

#> Warning: cannot compute exact p-value with ties
#>   Group                0        1        p      stat Effect Size (CI)  
#> 1 Observations                                                         
#> 2                      19       13                                     
#> 3 mpg                                                                  
#> 4      Mean (SD)       17 (3.8) 24 (6.2) 0.0039 0.64 -1.5 (-2.3; -0.65)
#> 5      Valid (missing) 19 (0)   13 (0)                                 
# specify only mean
atable(mpg ~ am, mtcars, numstats = c("Mean (SD)" = "{mean} ({sd})"))

#> Warning: cannot compute exact p-value with ties
#>   Group                0        1        p      stat Effect Size (CI)  
#> 1 Observations                                                         
#> 2                      19       13                                     
#> 3 mpg                                                                  
#> 4      Mean (SD)       17 (3.8) 24 (6.2) 0.0039 0.64 -1.5 (-2.3; -0.65)
#> 5      Valid (missing) 19 (0)   13 (0)                                 
# specify options by number
atable(mpg ~ am, mtcars, numstats = 1:2)

#> Warning: cannot compute exact p-value with ties
#>   Group                0        1        p      stat Effect Size (CI)  
#> 1 Observations                                                         
#> 2                      19       13                                     
#> 3 mpg                                                                  
#> 4      Mean (SD)       17 (3.8) 24 (6.2) 0.0039 0.64 -1.5 (-2.3; -0.65)
#> 5      Min - Max       10 - 24  15 - 34                                
#> 6      Valid (missing) 19 (0)   13 (0)                                 
atable(mpg ~ am, mtcars, numstats = c(1,3))

#> Warning: cannot compute exact p-value with ties
#>   Group                   0           1           p      stat
#> 1 Observations                                               
#> 2                         19          13                     
#> 3 mpg                                                        
#> 4      Mean (SD)          17 (3.8)    24 (6.2)    0.0039 0.64
#> 5      Median [Quartiles] 17 [15; 19] 23 [21; 30]            
#> 6      Valid (missing)    19 (0)      13 (0)                 
#>   Effect Size (CI)  
#> 1                   
#> 2                   
#> 3                   
#> 4 -1.5 (-2.3; -0.65)
#> 5                   
#> 6                   
# change to square brackets
atable(mpg ~ am, mtcars, numstats = c("Mean [SD]" = "{mean} [{sd}]"))

#> Warning: cannot compute exact p-value with ties
#>   Group                0        1        p      stat Effect Size (CI)  
#> 1 Observations                                                         
#> 2                      19       13                                     
#> 3 mpg                                                                  
#> 4      Mean [SD]       17 [3.8] 24 [6.2] 0.0039 0.64 -1.5 (-2.3; -0.65)
#> 5      Valid (missing) 19 (0)   13 (0)
